interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Christmas Caper
Review Date: 2017/11/12
Store: Shannen Doherty  (Actor),     Ty Olsen  (Actor),     David Winkler  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas
Product Description: ['After a heist goes bad, professional thief Cate Dove (Shannen Doherty) hides out in her hometown of Comfort, Connecticut when her sister, stuck on an island by a tropical storm, asks her to take care of her two children Parker and Annie until she can get back for Christmas. Not the most nurturing or sentimental of people, Cate spends most of her time scouting out the cozy suburban neighborhood with plans for another big score, as well as planning on how to get back at her deceitful partner Clive (Conrad Coates). As Christmas gets closer, however, Cate gets used to small town life, and she begins to realize her family, friends, and hunky local sheriff Hank (Ty Olsson) are making her rethink her priorities, and a crime-free Christmas in Comfort might be just what she needs this year.']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.75:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 0.7 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'FLP-12469', 'Director': 'David Winkler', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 28 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 28, 2008', 'Actors': 'Shannen Doherty, Ty Olsen', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Studio': 'Alchemy / Millennium', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: It’s not one of the greatest Christmas movies, but it’s pleasant enough. Actually, it’s better than I expected. Shannon Doherty does a good job with the part.
Review Title: Better Than I Expected
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Hawaii Five-0: Season 2
Alex O'Loughlin  (Actor),     Scott Caan  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Action & Adventure
["HAWAII FIVE-0 is a contemporary take on the classic series about a new elite federalized task force whose mission is to wipe out the crime that washes up on the Islands' sun-drenched beaches."]
{'Genre': 'Television, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': "Alex O'Loughlin, Masi Oka, Grace Park, Daniel Dae Kim, Scott Caan, Lauren German", 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '6', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.92 Ounces', 'Item model number': '540985509', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Box set, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '16 hours and 25 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 19, 2017', 'Actors': "Alex O'Loughlin, Scott Caan, Daniel Dae Kim, Grace Park, Masi Oka", 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Paramount Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '6'}
While I own & love the first season of Hawaii 5-0, I will not be purchasing Season Two. The fun and camaraderie of Season One was destroyed with slipshod writing and the introduction of the useless character of Lori Weston. Where I used to look forward to Monday nights to get my 5-0 fix, now I DVR the show and fast-forward through all the scenes that feature Lori. It's a shame, as I had initially planned to own all seasons as soon as they became available. Am sincerely hoping the writers do away with the Weston character in Season Three, and that the show regains its former greatness.
Won't Be Buying Season Two
Stolen Women, Captured Hearts
Janine Turner  (Actor),     Patrick Bergin  (Actor),     Jerry London  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
["Anna (Janine Turner), a beautiful young woman, allows her brother to arrange her marriage. She travels west to marry Daniel (Patrick Bergin), a man whom she has never met, but on the way is taken prisoner by the Sioux Indians. Their leader, the handsome warrior Tokalah (Michael Greyeyes), is set to kill Anna, until he realizes she is the woman who has come to him repeatedly in his dreams. He spares Anna's life and she continues to travel to Fort Hays where she meets and marries Daniel, the ordinary man her brother has chosen for her. After only one night with her new husband, Anna and her friend Sarah (Jean Louisa Kelly) are taken hostage by a tribe of Sioux warriors led by Tokolah. They are forced to live like the Sioux, learning their language, dressing like them and adapting to their customs. During this time Tokalah and Anna spend together, they give in to their emotions and, regardless of the consequences, they fall in love. After a year, the U.S. Cavalry and the Indians are at war and the women are rescued by General Custer. But Anna's heart still longs to be with Tokalah. Will she choose to follow her heart or obey the rules of convention?"]
{'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.5 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': 'CBMO46338DVD', 'Director': 'Jerry London', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 31 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 17, 2013', 'Actors': 'Janine Turner, Patrick Bergin, Jean Louisa Kelly, Michael Greyeyes, Rodney A Grant', 'Subtitles': 'German, Italian, English', 'Producers': 'Vanessa Greene', 'Studio': 'CBS Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
I always loved this movie, and was thrilled that it is available on DVD. What's not to love about the handsome Michael Greyeyes? Is it historically accurate? No. The real Anna Brewster Morgan's story is utterly tragic. But this film is a wonderful romantic escape. It would have been lovely if the real Anna's story had ended as this movie did.
A Favorite
Columbo: The Complete Series
Peter Falk  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Editor's Picks
['Legendary Peter Falk is a four-time Primetime Emmy Award-winner for his iconic role as the beloved, trenchcoat-wearing Police Lieutenant Columbo. Columbo is the landmark series that inspired a genre. And now, for the first time ever, all 69 episodes from its seven seasons and all 24 television movies are together in this 34-disc anthology. Every criminal, every innocent victim (and some not-so-innocent ones), and every wily deduction are here in one definitive collection. Seemingly befuddled but always brilliant, the cigar-chomping detective will have you following the clues and asking "just one more thing" until the last case is cracked.   Note: This set contains 34 discs which are contained in 8 cases.']
{'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.12 Pounds', 'Media Format': 'Color, Full Screen, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '99 hours and 52 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 16, 2012', 'Actors': 'Peter Falk', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), Unknown (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Studio': 'Universal', 'Number of discs': '34'}
My mom just sent this to me as an early Christmas present. She bought it here on Amazon (we’re both Prime customers) at a great price. I’ve always loved Columbo, and it’s wonderful to have the entire series to watch. It never gets old. The package arrived in great shape. If you’re a fan of Columbo, buy this! You won’t be disappointed.
So Happy to Own the Entire Series
All I Want For Christmas
Lauren Bacall  (Actor),     Thora Birch  (Actor),     Robert Lieberman  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
['All I Want For Christmas (DVD)', "If teenaged Ethan and his younger sister Hallie put every toy in Macy's on their Christmas list, it still wouldn't include what they want most. They want a miracle - they want their divorced parents back together! Wi th lots of humor, heart and yuletide sparkle, All I Want For Christmas i s all you could want in a family film treat. Ethan Randall (Dutch) and T hora Birch (Patriot Games) play the siblings who come up with a hilariou s plan to reunite their parents (Harley Jane Kozak and Jamey Sheridan). Movie legend Lauren Bac all plays the sympathetic grandmother who assist s the kids. And Leslie Nielsen (The Naked Gun. films) appears as Santa C laus. So what is the plan? Ho-ho-ho! Aren't you in for a surprise!", ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Kids & Family', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Kevin Nealon, Leslie Nielsen, Robert Lieberman, Thora Birch, Harley Jane Kozak, Ethan Randall, Jamey Sheridan, Lauren BacallKevin Nealon, Leslie Nielsen, Robert Lieberman, Thora Birch, Harley Jane Kozak, Ethan Randall, Jamey Sheridan, Lauren Bacall  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 32 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '883929303748', 'Director': 'Robert Lieberman', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 32 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 5, 2004', 'Actors': 'Lauren Bacall, Thora Birch, Harley Jane Kozak, Kevin Nealon, Leslie Nielsen', 'Studio': 'Warner Bros.', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Of course it’s cute, cliche, corny, and predictable. But it’s also utterly charming. I was delighted to finally own a copy, and it’s fun to watch again during the holidays.
A Fun Christmas movie

An Enduring Classic
A Charlie Brown Christmas (Remastered Deluxe Edition)
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas, Timeless Holiday Favorites
['Product Description', 'A Charlie Brown Christmas Deluxe Edition (DVD)', ']]>', 'Set Contains:', 'The 2008 remastered DVD has two main extras: the similarly themed 1991 special', "It's Christmastime Again, Charlie Brown", ', and a new documentary "A Christmas Miracle: The Making of', 'A Charlie Brown Christmas', "(2008, 16 minutes), with interviews of Lee Mendelson, Bill Melendez, Jeannie Schulz, and others discussing the creation of the special, the adoption of Vince Guaraldi's music, the use of children's voices, and the network's negative reaction to the show.", '--David Horiuchi']

Never Gets Old

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Genre Preference**: The user enjoys action and crime television focused on elite task forces, while also appreciating family films and romantic dramas that incorporate historical themes and emotional depth. They have a nostalgic fondness for classic detective series and timeless family favorites, with a particular interest in holiday narratives. 
- **Content Engagement**: Shows a strong affinity for seasonal films, reinforcing a love for stories that evoke joy and warmth during the festive season, even opting for lighter narratives that may exceed expectations.
- **Review Style**: Articulates preferences with emotional insight, positively emphasizing works that resonate personally, especially those that embody warmth and nostalgia. 
- **Commitment to Series/Films**: Invests time in full series and standalone films, continually reassessing favorites based on storytelling quality and character depth. 
- **Expectations**: Expects high-caliber storytelling across genres and has a growing appreciation for nostalgic comedies that blend humor with heart. 
- **Viewing Habits**: Prefers live viewing but utilizes DVR for flexibility. Enjoys rewatching beloved seasonal classics, underscoring strong ties to holiday traditions while celebrating enduring films that provide comfort and familiarity.

Overall, the user exhibits discerning tastes, balancing serious narratives with an appreciation for lighthearted, heartwarming films, especially during the holiday season. Their recent engagement indicates a willingness to explore enjoyable narratives that may not be critically acclaimed but still provide pleasant viewing experiences.
